SEARCH
Package oop2.jeopardy.parser

Class CsvParser

java.lang.Object
oop2.jeopardy.parser.CsvParser
All Implemented Interfaces:
QuestionParser
public class CsvParser extends Object implements QuestionParser
Parses Jeopardy questions from a CSV file stored in the application's resources.

This parser uses Apache Commons CSV to read rows where each represents a Jeopardy-style question with a category, monetary value, question text, four answer options (Aâ€“D), and a correct answer key.

The parser performs trimming, validation, and throws informative exceptions for malformed input. It returns a fully populated list of Question objects ready for use in the game.

Expected CSV Columns:

  • Category
  • Value
  • Question
  • OptionA
  • OptionB
  • OptionC
  • OptionD
  • CorrectAnswer (A/B/C/D)
Version:
1.0
Author:
Kadie Bisnath - 816036090

  • Method Details

    • load

      public List<Question> load(String filename) throws Exception
      Loads and parses a CSV file containing Jeopardy question data.

      The CSV file must exist inside the application's resource directory (i.e., accessible through the classpath). Header names must match the expected column names exactly, though whitespace is trimmed for values.

      Specified by:
      load in interface QuestionParser
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the CSV file located in the resources folder
      Returns:
      a list of parsed Question objects
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if filename is null
      FileNotFoundException - if the CSV file cannot be found as a resource
      NumberFormatException - if the "Value" field is not a valid integer
      IllegalArgumentException - if "CorrectAnswer" is not A, B, C, or D
      Exception - if parsing fails for any other reason

    • validateQuestion

      private void validateQuestion(Question q)
      Validates a Question instance to ensure it contains all required Jeopardy question data and follows the same strict rules used by JsonParser.

      This method enforces the following validation constraints:

      • The Question object itself must not be null
      • Category text must be non-null and non-blank
      • Question text must be non-null and non-blank
      • Value must be a strictly positive integer
      • The options map must:
        • Exist (not null)
        • Contain exactly four entries
        • Include keys "A", "B", "C", and "D"
        • Provide non-null, non-blank text for each option
      • The correct answer must be non-null, non-blank, and exactly one of "A", "B", "C", or "D"

      If any rule is violated, this method throws an IllegalArgumentException describing the specific failure.

      Parameters:
      q - the Question object to validate
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any validation rule fails or the question data is malformed
